Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been pretty good. I actually reached out to a few venues about open mic nights.
That’s fantastic! How did that go?
I got a couple of responses, and I’m thinking about performing next week!
That’s exciting! How do you feel about getting on stage again?
I’m a little nervous, but mostly I’m just stoked to share my music.
That’s a healthy mix of emotions. What do you think will help you manage the nerves?
I think just reminding myself that it’s all about having fun and connecting with people.
That’s a great mindset! Have you practiced any coping techniques before performing?
Yeah, I’ve been doing more breathing exercises. They help a lot.
That’s wonderful to hear! Practicing those techniques can really make a difference.
For sure. I’ve also been trying to visualize the performance going well.
Visualization can be a powerful tool for building confidence. How does it feel to visualize your success?
It feels good. It makes me believe that I can do it.
Belief in yourself is crucial. What else have you been focusing on in your music journey?
I’ve been writing a lot more. I feel like I’m finding my voice.
That’s great progress! Can you share what themes or ideas you’re exploring in your writing?
I’m trying to write about my experiences and how they shape me. Like, the ups and downs of life.
That sounds like a relatable theme. How do you think your audience will connect with those messages?
I hope they’ll see that it’s okay to struggle and that they’re not alone in it.
That’s a powerful message. Music has a unique way of connecting people.
Yeah, I want to inspire others through my art.
That’s a beautiful intention. Have you thought about how you can share your message beyond performances?
I’ve been thinking about recording some of my songs and putting them online.
Sharing your music online can help reach a wider audience. What’s stopping you from taking that step?
I guess I’m just worried about how it’ll be received.
It’s natural to feel that way. Remember, not everyone will resonate with your work, and that’s okay. What matters is that you’re expressing yourself.
True! I just need to push through that fear, I guess.
Exactly. What small step can you take towards recording your music?
Maybe I can set aside some time this week to work on recording a demo.
That sounds like a solid plan! Setting aside time can help you stay focused.
Yeah, I’ll do it. I want to make it happen.
I believe in you! Let’s check in on your progress next time.
For sure! I’m excited to share.
Great! Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been feeling a bit overwhelmed with everything going on.
That’s understandable. What’s been contributing to that feeling?
Just balancing music, friends, and everything else. Sometimes it feels like too much.
It’s important to prioritize your well-being. Have you thought about ways to manage your time and energy?
I think I need to learn to say no sometimes. I don’t want to let anyone down, but I can’t do it all.
Setting boundaries is essential for self-care. How do you feel about practicing saying no?
It’s hard for me, but I know I need to try.
It’s okay to prioritize yourself. Maybe start with small commitments and gradually build your confidence.
Yeah, that makes sense. I’ll give it a shot.
Good! Remember, it’s about finding a balance that works for you.
Thanks for reminding me. I appreciate it.
Of course! I’m here to support you. Let’s keep working on these goals together.
Sounds good! I feel more motivated after talking.
I’m glad to hear that! Looking forward to our next session.
Me too! Bye!
Bye!
